resources.string: The body mass index (BMI), or Quetelet index, is a measure for human body shape based on an individuals mass and height.
Basal metabolic rate (BMR) is the amount of energy expended daily by humans and other animals at rest.
The body fat percentage is the total mass of fat divided by total body mass; body fat includes essential body fat and storage body fat.
Waistâ€“hip ratio or waist-to-hip ratio (WHR) is the ratio of the circumference of the waist to that of the hips.
Daily Calorie needs tells you the amount of calories you need to intake to maintain the current weight.
